column2: AL DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 2. Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
3. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 4. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: signal and pull into the slow lane.
column6: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
column8: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

column2: 5. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column6: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column8: talk on your cell phone while driving.

column2: 6. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column4: yield to the vehicles on your left only.
column6: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.

column2: 7. This road sign means:

11. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column8: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.

column2: 12. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 13. Regulatory signs are:
14. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 16. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column6: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.
column8: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.

column2: 17. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
18. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column8: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
20. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 21. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
22. Motorcycles:
column4: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column6: are easier to see than cars.
column8: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 23. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 24. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
column6: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 25. Green and white signs:
column4: give information about directions and distances.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.

column2: 26. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 27. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column8: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 28. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
29. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
30. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column6: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 31. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column6: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column8: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 32. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
33. A red traffic sign means?
34. This road sign is:
35. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
36. This road sign means:
column6: Look both ways before crossing the intersection

column2: 37. This sign means:
38. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 39. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 40. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: slow down and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and invite them to take the right-of-way.
